title.narrative: 3.3 POLICIES AND LEGAL FRAMEWORK STRENGTHENING

description.narrative: Decision-makers and national institutions have the capacity to strengthen and harmonize the policy and legal framework, coordination mechanisms, and monitoring / evaluation, in terms of protection against GBV, abuse, exploitation and harmful practices, which contributes to Access To Justice, Birth Registration, Child Protection Systems, Data And Child Protection, Harmful Practices (Fgm/C And Child Marriage), Justice For Children, Prevention And Response Services For Violence Against Children. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Advocacy And Public Engagement, Evaluations, Research And Data, Operational Support To Programme Delivery, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: By 2018, the most vulnerable children are better protected against violence, exploitation and abuse in all situations

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Decision-makers and national institutions have the capacity to strengthen and harmonize the policy and legal framework,coordination mechanisms, and monitoring / evaluation, in terms of protection against GBV, abuse, exploitation and harmfulpractices

description.narrative: Thanks to UNICEF support, 17/19 targeted districts ensure incident monitoring and periodic reporting in child protection. Child Protection coordination mechanisms are strengthened in 21 districts. A system of alert, case referral and incident monitoring through Rapid Pro was successfully piloted in one district and replication is underway. | Status:Met | As-of Date:31/01/2019
